title: Task Models for Stimulus Based Multiple-Choice Question
subject: Social Studies (2017-)

document.title: Task Models for Stimulus Based Multiple-Choice Question

2AF7BCEA4BAF44C498FB826448CE8760.description:
Students are given one stimulus or two stimuli and asked to identify a
response to a problem (issue)

4F202F75B6484A86BBA258722B6BDC4B.description:
Students are given one stimulus or two stimuli and asked to identify a
problem (issue)

B3D285C6955D41DC84526E74CCBDF49E.description:
Students are given a stimulus and asked to identify how historical
events are related chronologically.

00E41FA7D10C4A00B3A210DA1202D37B.description:
Students are given a stimulus and asked to identify a course of action
recommended by a historical figure, a group, or a government.

06C1830525BF45FC8271C2731736CED4.description:
Students are given one stimulus or two stimuli and asked to identify a
stakeholder or a stakeholder’s issue.

7DE8D912E7AE48A5A1F193300889CC46.description:
Students are given a visual stimulus such as a map, graph, chart, time
line, cartoon, or photograph and asked to extract relevant information to
answer a question, or to respond to a claim or argument.

721CB6F378354C6E9BFBE7460B2EB20F.description:
Students are given a stimulus and asked to identify an informed action
taken by an individual, group, or government connected to civic
activism.

E5A1B38913BA4E4B98D28B4C17CD1BEE.description:
Students are given one stimulus or two stimuli and asked to identify a
difference in the described phenomenon (historical development,
historical event, geographic setting, economic situation, individual’s
action/belief)

001C7F39A4A146BE9D75638376537393.description:
Students are given one stimulus or two stimuli and asked to identify a
similarity in the described phenomenon (historical development,
historical event, geographic setting, economic situation, individual’s
action/belief)

8555CC4B11514A2CAD2BC3F22F22F40D.description:
Students are given a stimulus and asked to identify the impact of time
and place on an issue or event linked to that stimulus.

FF0639F71EA740C08A2A00E24C408D3B.description:
Students are given a stimulus and asked to identify a central effect of
the described phenomenon.

F6A3FE4667824BBA9ACD1125A24B03F6.description:
Students are given a stimulus and asked to identify a central cause of
the described phenomenon.

B6327C10E8E94B40B7C09BCE6C3F867B.description:
Students are given a stimulus and asked to identify significance of an
event, action, idea, or development as part of change or part of
continuity in history.

CE19C89CE85E4703B5BB4AC70885C6F9.description:
Students are given a stimulus and asked to identify the significance of a
turning point in history.

305017C7479F40BA986DB35E41721C24.description:
Students are given a stimulus and asked to select a plausible claim that
logically flows from evidence presented.

9D70CF168D0049EB84829754F3470D3F.description:
Students are given a stimulus and asked to identify support for a given
claim (bound in same timeframe/event/space).

78D47CEF0F45455AA0958C6FBD73FC4B.description: Students are given a stimulus and asked to identify location of source in time and/or place of sources using background knowledge.

C5FECF77C8FE428DBC8F5CE3BA98CECA.description: Students are given a stimulus and asked to identify the format of the source of sources using background knowledge. .

C5576DC1D0F04A84A16609877CE14EDF.description: Students are given a stimulus and asked to identify bias of sources using background knowledge. .

761A7484FF614E29A8B6FB41DCA3C4F0.description: Students are given a stimulus and asked to identify the intended audience of sources using background knowledge. .

3D7B3E80626F4AA2B25BB39881C8420C.description: Students are given a stimulus and asked to identify point of view of sources using background knowledge. .

F00D9B764A114818B7F93E6FDA02444C.description: Students are given a stimulus and asked to identify purpose of sources using background knowledge. .

2B635D4CED334D6B97C596517BA44FA6.description: Students are given a stimulus and asked to identify context of sources using background knowledge.

A5BFDA98BBB54BF1B0A56FFB99639DDE.description:
Students are given a stimulus and asked to identify point of view, context, bias, format of source, location of source in time
and/or place, and/or intended audience of sources using background
knowledge.

D511CCB3AA22454C9EA71A5838837130.description:
Students are given a stimulus and asked to evaluate and classify
(identify) best use.
